Class PanelPlay

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • PanelPlay
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class PanelPlay
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    The panel for the actual gameplay of JMania.
    See Also:

    • Field Detail

      • scores

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> scores
        A list of scores separated by each individual arrow. Stored as integers, such that 3 is perfect, 2 is great, 1 is good, and 0 is a miss.

      • smf

        public Simfile smf
        The default arrow sprite objects.

      • noteindex

        public int noteindex
        The current note which is to appear, based on order of time.

      • file

        public java.io.File file
        The object used to store the audio file being used.

      • music

        public javax.sound.sampled.Clip music
        The audio stream as a Clip object which can be directly played and accessed.

    • Method Detail

      • addnoteindex

        public int addnoteindex()
        A function that adds to the note index variable, in case variables must be static within a function.

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
        The function that runs based on the timer. Graphics and music are mostly handled within this function.
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener

      • paintComponent

        public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
        The function that handles drawing the graphics on to the screen.
        Overrides:
        paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent

      • Judgement

        public int Judgement(Simfile sim,
                     int notenum,
                     int y)
        Determines how accurate the pressed arrow is compared to when it should be pressed (through y-coordinates of arrows). Returns 3 for perfect, 2 for great, 1 for good, and 0 for a miss.

      • calcScore

        public int calcScore()
        Calculates the score by finding the sum of the Judgement scores.

      • calcAccuracy

        public double calcAccuracy()
        Calculates the accuracy by dividing calcScore() by the maximum possible score (the amount of arrows multiplied by 3, as 3 is perfect). Returns a double which is a percentage.

      • addNote

        public void addNote(int score)
        Adds an arrow's score to the total list of scores.

      • updateResults

        public void updateResults(int judge)
        Updates the judgement text, displaying whether the player got a perfect, great, good, or miss on the most recently pressed arrow.
